page.title: 01Introduction to Portsmouth
page.content: From the few small villages on Portsea Island in 1087, Portsmouth has developed into a thriving city with one of the highest{population} {densities}in England. The natural harbour, where King John established his dockyard, became a major{Naval} {Base}of national importance during the campaigns of the Middle Ages and two World Wars. From 1800, Portsmouth expanded from the small fortified town in the SW to engulf the whole island. It became a city in 1926, with a population of nearly{250,000.}Since 1945, the city has expanded into dormitory estates along the coastal and London roads, but the island population has dropped to{180,000.}With the decline in the Navy, local industries, ferry port and tourism are increasingly important. -James Ward, Portsmouth Grammar School
